Header: Dhamma school construction program initiated at Gampaha by Minister Sajith Premadasa
Content: Colombo (News 1st) – Deputy Leader of the United National Party, Minister Sajith Premadasa recently placed the foundation stone for the construction of a Dhamma School at the Buthpitiya Sri Jayasekararama Temple in the Gampaha District. A sum of Rs.4 million was allocated for the construction of this building under the “ Sidu Daham Sevana ” Program with provision from the Central Cultural Fund. Minister Sajith Premadasa, speaking at the event stated that they are deploying various programs for the development of Dhamma education adding that those who looted public funds are attempting to sabotage those programs. He reasoned that those who looted public funds and exploited the public property acted on behalf of their personal benefit without thinking about the country or its people. The Government has directly intervened to build Dhamma education in the country for the first time, he added. “Sadly, those who cannot be pleased with it are making attempts to ruin it”, the Minister continued.
